Dialogue: The Duke?  What did you do?

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: This kid, this package boy could bring down the whole east coast. If he decides to turn states he could dismantle us... totally. But it looks like for now, he's content with just killing us one by one. And even worse the kid is good at it. I mean I had a prodigy on my hands the whole time and didn't even know it.

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: Listen kid, I think you better understand who you're dealing with here.

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: Yeah. I was only twelve or thirteen when you guys used to talk about him, like he was a ghost or something.

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: Your dad and I used him three times over twenty years, only when everything went totally fucked. Believe me kid, you don't want this guy unless you are 100% sure you need him. He is... a fuckin' monster.

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: I've had this guy in front of me, and I couldn't tell you what he looks like, sounds like. He is the Picasso of assassins, kid. He plants hair samples, blood. Puts skin under fingernails. He is a fucking genius. Only one problem. He's been rotting in prison for twenty-five or thirty years. Don't even know if he's still alive. Or if he's even up to it.

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: There's ways around that.

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: Go find one.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Let's talk some business here. I know a sick fuck... makes the ones we been doing look like altar boys. Worst night of my life when I met this guy.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: The guy never says a fuckin' word to me. We're driving for 25 minutes. Never a sigh, no throat clearing, nothing. And his face, blank man. Just nothing there.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: I didn't see what he was doing while he was in there.

Speaker: the man
Dialogue: I have a poker game at the house every Saturday with a couple of guys you know. Why don't you come down? Wife makes a hell of a bar-g-que.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Yeah... yeah, I'd like that. Tell me something. What did they do?

Speaker: the man
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Worst day of my life, man.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Well, I'm sold.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Don't worry, Roc. We'll do this guy right and you'll feel a lot better.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Who the fuck was he, Rocco? I know you fuckin' know!

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Fuck you! I told you I never saw him before!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Well he sure as fuck knew you!

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Fuck you both! Ya ask me, he was aiming at you!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Okay. Here's what happened.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: They waited in a parked car down the street for the kid to leave.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: There he goes.  Okay, gentlemen. Are we ready to bring this man into the light? Are we ready to truly do the work of the Lord?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: A-fuckin'-men!

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: This is so fuckin' cool!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: They went in through the garage. The kid says he leaves it open when he takes his bike out.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Don't fuck with me lady. I'll kill you.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: The wife says she doesn't know what happened after she hit the code. She just remembers going down. But, judging by the burn mark on her back, I think what they did...

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: ...was use a stun gun on her.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Now the guy knows a friend is coming to the game. And they know that this door can only be opened from the inside. So they wait... and when that door opens, man...

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: All of them.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Nobody was ready for it. Devastation, panic! This was like shooting fish in a fuckin' barrel!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Now these guys dove under the table. The trajectory on the bullets show they came from straight across. So this means one of our shooters... dropped to his knees...

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Shit!... Shit! He ain't here.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What the fuck do you mean?

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: I mean he ain't here.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Look again for fuck sake!

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: I know what the fuck he looks like!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Something went wrong. Right here.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Let the boy go!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: C'mon Roc!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Now, one of these guys is a real sicko. He knew this man. He wanted him to suffer, to feel every second of a painful death.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Help me you assholes!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: This guy is one bad motherfucker.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: I don't wanna die!!!!!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: I've never seen wounds like these before, but whatever he used on this guy, it was a blunt object and they took it with them.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: They exited out the front door. And they had no fucking idea what they were in for.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Now they are staring at six guys with guns drawn. It was a fucking ambush.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: And this was a fucking bomb dropping in Beaver Cleaverville! For a few seconds this place was Armageddon! There was a fire fight!

Speaker: il duce
Dialogue: No!... No! No!...

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: What if it was just one guy with six guns?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Why don't you let me do the thinking, huh, genius?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: What is taking so long with those blood samples?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: They used ammonia... none of this shit is any good... Fuck... You know what this means?! Even if we get suspects in this case, we got nothing... Nothing!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Who the fuck are they?! I've never seen any-fucking-thing like this in my whole fucking life. Who the fuck are they?!!

Speaker: duffy
Dialogue: What? That's it?!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: What?  What, that guy?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: That's the guy that got us off the hook with the "Checkov" thing.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: And he is one smart man.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: They got nothing.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: This guy is very sharp. If he hasn't figured us out yet, he will.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You bet your ass he will.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Well, I'd say that makes him a lia- fuckin-bility.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: He isn't to be touched.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: He's a good man.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Okay... whatever.  My Mom's gonna kill me.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: No. This is all wrong. David Della Rocco?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Yeah. Maria, this is Smecker. Could you find me the visitor's list for the day the MacManus brothers were in and read me all the names?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Okay, thank you.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: You've had quite a bit, Paul. Are you sure you...

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Pour the drink, faggot-ass!

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Okay... But I don't cuddle.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Hey! We gotta talk about this early morning church shit.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We have to go now.  We're on the lamb.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: You gonna do what I say, got it?

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: I'm sorry you're gonna hafta see this. Don't look at me!

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I didn't see.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Shut up! Shut the fuck up!

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Don't do this my son.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Open it!

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Have you no fear of God?

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: That's who I'm doing this for, now open the fuckin' thing.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Father, I'll do you right here.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: God have mercy on my soul.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: You little fuck. Let him go. I'll drop you right here.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Okay, just calm down. He could hurt us, brother. He could ruin the whole thing.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Let him go or I will deliver you, right now.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: You won't do it Connor, you won't. You love me man.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Hello? You there?

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Y-Yes my son.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Do your thing Father. Don't fuck this up.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: What do you want me to say?

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Just be natural, goddamit.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: How long since your last confession, my son?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Oh, Christ, uh, I've never confessed.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: According to the dogma of the Catholic church, I should probably burst into flames right here in this booth. But I've come here for advice, not salvation.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Why have you come to a church for council if you're not religious?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Why have I come to a church? I never have before. I guess I just... felt I should.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: What is it my son?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: It's ethics. I put evil men behind bars, but the law has miles of red tape and loopholes for these... cocksuckers to slip through. I've found out there are these two young men who fix the situation with an iron fist. As if they have God's permission. But what they do is wrong and I should arrest them... technically.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: God's permission? God doesn't...

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: But in this day and age I believe what they do is... necessary. I feel it is... correct.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You believe?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You feel?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You feel? A soul is what gives you feelings. Happiness, guilt, right or wrong. It is a conduit through which the Lord speaks to us. You felt that your answers would be here in the house of God today. You feel these men are necessary. The Lord has spoken to you twice this day.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Has he now?

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You have entered the house of the Lord of your own free will speaking of beliefs and feelings. Is it so much to believe that God has brought you here?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: I guess not.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: It is easy to be sarcastic about religion. It is harder to take small hints from God, your feelings and listen to them... to take a stand.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: You're right.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Those who do not act are in a constant state of ethical indecision.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: I want to stand for what I believe in, father.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Then you must find out what your beliefs are.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: I believe these young men are right.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You know them personally?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Do you think they would harm an innocent man, for any reason?

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: No. They would never do that.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Well, the two Irish guys wouldn't. But the Italian guy, he might. He's kind of an idiot.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: Goddam right, I am.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: I'm beginning to see. I've been doing my job... well for fifteen years and it's just not enough. All the things I wish I could do, these guys are doing. Millions of dollars in tax payers' money wasted on shit like wire taps and surveillance. Theses boys go in and take care of it for the price of a bullet.  Ww-what do you think I should do? Because I'm a law man.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: The laws of God are higher than the laws of man.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Yes! Yes! I was thinking that, too. No. I was feeling it. All I needed was to hear you say it! Amen! I'll help them.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Forgive me father.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Thank you, Father, thank you.  Whatever. Goodbye, amen.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: I wouldn't have, uh, killed you, Father.  Dominus Ominus. Remember, you're bound. You can't talk about this... to anyone.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Just go!

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: The Lord works in mysterious ways.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: That's all you can give me?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Well, the light caught the side of his face for a second. And it looked like he had a gray beard, maybe... late fifties, early sixties.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: So you're telling me it was one guy with six guns? A-and he was a senior fucking citizen?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: I think it's better if we find this man before he finds us again.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: I'll see what I can do. How do I get in touch with you?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: We're going to hit Poppa Joe tonight, right in the comfort of his own home. Then we move on to New York. It's getting a bit hot for us here.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Be careful.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: I'll call you tonight, afterwards.

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: I don't know who he is. Nobody does.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: What did he bring him in for?

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: Needed an outsider. The package boy knows everyone. He'd spot our hitters a mile away.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Just for him?

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: Well he's the one shooting up all his guys, right? He's scared of the kid. Says he's real good, got every available gun in the city up there.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Up where?

Speaker: augustus
Dialogue: Up his house. I don't know what's going on but I know it's gotta have something to do with this kid.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: Oh fuck!

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: You gonna tell me what's going on here?! Huh! You little fuck! Gimme some answers!

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: What do you guys think?

Speaker: geno
Dialogue: They're tough. No way they're gonna talk.

Speaker: hojo
Dialogue: I know Rocco. He ain't smart enough for this shit. These other guys are the brains. He's just a player.

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: There's only one way to get them to talk.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: You guys?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: We're here brother.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: You gotta keep going.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We'll keep going, Roc.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: You'll make it outta here. You can't ever stop, not ever.

Speaker: chappy
Dialogue: Once you set him in motion, you can't call him off. He thinks it's still on.

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: Oh Jesus Christ!

Speaker: hojo
Dialogue: What? I...

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: Hey, I don't have my name spray painted on the front of this house. There are no big pictures of me anywhere. If this guy thinks the job is still a go then I got green money says the mother fucker's out in the bushes already. I'm fucking gone! I'm leaving you guys to deal with this.

Speaker: geno
Dialogue: One fucking guy, so what.

Speaker: hojo
Dialogue: Why don't you take the front.  You guys cover those other exits and if you see him, don't flag him down, just kill the mother fucker. I'm going back down to work on these pricks.

Speaker: geno
Dialogue: Listen baby. Tonight ain't the night for this shit.  Bevo's so great. Always sending us hot girls.

Speaker: smecker
Dialogue: You look like you could use a quickie.

Speaker: geno
Dialogue: Hey, Chappy!

Speaker: chappy
Dialogue: What the fuck?

Speaker: geno
Dialogue: I ain't been laid in a week. Take five minutes.

Speaker: chappy
Dialogue: If I die cause you're getting a piece of ass, I'll come back and beat you to death with a big rubber dick.

Speaker: geno
Dialogue: Don't worry about it.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: How far are we going with this, Da?

Speaker: father
Dialogue: The questions is not, "how far?" The question is, "Do you possess the constitution, the depth of faith to go as far as is needed?"

Speaker: father
Dialogue: How long do these put a man down for?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Ten minutes.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Twenty is a bit better.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: Due to the lack of hard evidence......

Speaker: father
Dialogue: All media to the back! Drop the cameras! Drop 'em!

Speaker: father
Dialogue: You people have been chosen to reveal our existence to the world. You will witness what happens here today and you will tell of it afterwards.

Speaker: yakavetta
Dialogue: Fuckin' do something!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Now, you will receive us.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We do not ask for your poor or your hungry.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: We do not want your tired and sick.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It is your corrupt we claim.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: It is your evil, who will be sought by us.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: With every breath we shall hunt them down.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Each day we will spill their blood till it rains down from the skies.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Do not kill, do not rape, do not steal. These are principles which every man of every faith can embrace.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: These are not polite suggestions. They are codes of behavior and those that ignore them will pay the dearest cost.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: There are varying degrees of evil. We urge you lesser forms of filth  Not to push the bounds and cross over into true corruption... into our domain.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: For if you do, there will come the day when you look behind you and see we three. And on that day you will reap it.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: And we will send you to whatever God you wish.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I guess we all know what is right and wrong. We all know. Nobody needs to be convinced of what he was... I'm going home now to have my first real full night's sleep.
